header.relationships: Close family, partners, very close friends
header.topics: Work, family events (birthday and Christening plans), general conversation
header.activity: Mother, Father and daughter talking about their plans.
header.conv_type: Discussing, inquiring, complaining, requesting, making arrangements

speaker.fls: Imogen has just started French and Spanish at school. At this point she only knows a few dozen words of these languages -- level unspecified

body.u: so what's on the agenda for your erm year seven pupil tonight then ?
yeah we're doing some maths of course but erm it's multiplying and dividing by ten a hundred and a thousand so it'll be about moving the digits left or right
yeah and then we're using that to then multiply by multiples of ten a hundred and a thousand so doing like erm

well if you do I dunno che-che-che-che-che twelve times a hundred got your twelve and you move it two to the left so you get twelve hundred but if you do if you wanna do twelve times five hundred you do twelve times five first and then you use the rule to move it two points to the
no you don't add your noughts on
oh that's what I did well I I just you just count up the number of noughts five hundred
cos that's the way yeah that's the way we were taught
just count up the number of noughts and put those noughts on but er yeah you just the the teaching methods
okay one one point two then times one hundred one point two zero zero?
adding a naught on aren't I?
you you you move the point then
no you move the point two don't you? so it's a hundred and twenty
we always used to just move the point left or right
because there's always after the point there's nought so if and you don't add them they're always there
yeah but if you if you use the rule if y
so twelve is twelve point nought nought nought nought nought nought nought nought nought nought nought
yeah yeah yeah but if you use the rule if you times by a hundred you add two noughts on the end then if you times the number one point two by one hundred you'd say oh well it's one point two
which isn't cos that's the same number
so is just telling me that I've got it all wrong
but obviously I wouldn't know that
the rule is you move yeah move the point or but we've got a erm a printer out like a

hundred thousand erm ten thousand thousand hundred tens you can't call them units any more you call them ones point tenths hundredth thousandths and so then you've got digit cards so she makes a number and then you times it by a thousand so each digit moves three places to the left and then obviously if you've got any space before your point still then you've gotta
